An Assembly_alternate_product is a type of where the alternate is valid only for a particular design. The alternate is valid for all instances of the defining_base_product inherited from within that design.
In specifying the components to be used in an assembly, it is a fairly common practice to stipulate that any usage of a given component (such as referenced by a part number, for example) in that assembly may be replaced by some other specified component. Each of those other components is then an Assembly_alternate_product for the specified component (defining_base_product) for that assembly. The Assembly_alternate_product supports only this assembly-level alternate, that is, it only refers to components that can serve as alternates for any usage of the specified component (the basis_context) in that assembly.
the basis_context specifies the role of the for the Assembly_alternate_product.
